title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K.Rowling
subject: Fantasy
description: Most reviews were very favourable, commenting on Rowling's imagination, humour, simple, direct style and clever plot construction, although a few complained that the final chapters seemed rushed.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
author: J.K.Rowling
subject: Fantasy
description: Although Rowling says she found it difficult to finish the book, it won high praise and awards from critics, young readers, and the book industry, although some critics thought the story was perhaps too frightening for younger children.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
author: J.K.Rowling
subject: Fantasy
description: The book sold 68,000 copies in just three days after its release in the United Kingdom and since has sold over three million in the country. The book won the 1999 Whitbread Children's Book Award, the Bram Stoker Award, and the 2000 Locus Award for Best Fantasy Novel and was short-listed for other awards, including the Hugo.

title: A Doll's House
author: Henrik Ibsen
subject: Drama
description: The play is significant for the way it deals with the fate of a married woman, who at the time in Norway lacked reasonable opportunities for self-fulfillment in a male-dominated world, despite the fact that Ibsen denied it was his intent to write a feminist play.

title: The Time Machine
author: H. G. Wells
subject: Sci-Fi
description: A work of future history and speculative evolution, Time Machine is interpreted in modern times as a commentary on the increasing inequality and class divisions of Wells' era, which he projects as giving rise to two separate human species: the fair, childlike Eloi, and the savage, simian Morlocks, distant descendants of the contemporary upper and lower classes respectively.

title: Strong Poison
author: Dorothy L. Sayers
subject: Mystery
description: The novel opens with mystery author Harriet Vane on trial for the murder of her former lover, Phillip Boyes: a writer with strong views on atheism, anarchy, and free love.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
subject: Thriller
description: Pulling off a novel where the protagonist stays mum isn't easy, but this impressive, immersive debut―Brad Pitt's company has snapped up film rights―establishes Michaelides as a writer to watch.

title: Little Bee
author: Chris Cleave
subject: Contemporary
description: Millions of people have read, discussed, debated, cried, and cheered with Little Bee, a Nigerian refugee girl whose violent and courageous journey​ puts a stunning face on the worldwide refugee crisis​.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
subject: Romance
description: Austen's most popular novel, the unforgettable story of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy. Nominated as one of America’s best-loved novels by PBS’s The Great American Read.

author: Trey Babber
